intro: Dituilis, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Dituilis has hairy leaves and a short, stout stem, and it is often found in disturbed soils. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
